item.description:
Yankee Brass Band Concert

Saturday, July 28, 2012

at Stark Park - North River Road (an alternate location will be announced in case of rain)

TODAY - Due to the uncertain weather forecast, the free concert by the Yankee Brass Band will take place in the Millyard Museum - 200 Bedford Street beginning at 6:00 p.m. There is plenty of parking. Chairs will be available, but if you have your own seating, please pack it in the trunk of your car in case we run out. Come and hear this wonderful band play Civil War-era music on authentic period instruments! For questions call (603)622-7531.

 

6:00 p.m.

FREE Admission

No pre-registration required

 

Bring your blanket and chairs, pack a picnic, and join us in Stark Park to hear the music of the Yankee Brass Band. The Band, led by music director, Paul Maybery, is a historically accurate recreation of an American Brass Band circa 1840-1870 and performs music of the period in an appropriate style and on the authentic instruments. Band members perform in attire that was common for the era and will give their audience a glimpse into the traditions

of historic American band music.

 

This concert is sponsored by the Manchester Historic Association and presented in collaboration with the Friends of Stark Park.
item.name: Yankee Brass Band Concert at Stark Park
